_comment: Entity type IDs must match backend/graph/entities_edges.py:
Update this comment block when entity types change.

examples._note: Work stress, therapy techniques, mix of person/place/org/activity
examples.episode_content:
Today was one of those days where everything felt heavier than usual. I woke up late, which threw off my whole morning routine. By the time I got to Philz Coffee to meet Marcus, I was already in a weird headspace.

Marcus could tell something was off. We sat in our usual spot by the window and he just listened while I vented about work stuff - the pressure at Stripe has been intense lately with the new payments integration launch. My manager Elena keeps saying I'm doing great but I can't shake the feeling I'm falling behind.

After coffee, I walked through Dolores Park alone. The sun was out and families were having picnics. I did my breathing exercises on a bench near the tennis courts - the ones Dr. Patel taught me. Four counts in, hold for seven, out for eight. It helped a little.

examples._note: Running club, social breakfast, career goals - many entities
examples.episode_content:
Had my weekly check-in with the Bay Area Runners Club this morning. We met at Crissy Field at 6am - way too early but the sunrise over the Golden Gate Bridge made it worth it. Sarah led the warm-up today since Coach Martinez was out sick.

Afterward, a few of us grabbed breakfast at Mama's on Washington Square. I sat with Tom and his girlfriend Jessica. They're planning a trip to Japan next spring and couldn't stop talking about it. Tom works at Salesforce and apparently they have amazing travel benefits.

Spent the afternoon at the SF Public Library working on my photography portfolio. I'm trying to get into the Adobe Creative Residency program - the deadline is next month and I still need to finish my artist statement.

examples._note: Example using Entity fallback (type 0) for things that don't fit other categories
examples.episode_content:
Couldn't sleep last night so I finally started reading that copy of Meditations by Marcus Aurelius that's been sitting on my nightstand for months. There's something about Stoic philosophy that clicks for me right now - the idea that we can only control our own reactions, not external events.

I've been thinking a lot about my grandmother's old saying: 'worry is a rocking chair'. She passed it down from her mother, apparently it's an old Irish proverb. It keeps echoing in my head whenever I catch myself spiraling.

Made some chamomile tea around 3am and sat with Luna on the couch. She always knows when something's off. By the time the sun came up I actually felt a little lighter.
